On this page

VitePress Config.mts Guide ​

File Overview ​

docs/.vitepress/config.mts is the core configuration file for VitePress projects, using ES module syntax (.mts extension indicates TypeScript module). It defines site-wide settings, theme configuration, navigation menus, etc.

Basic Structure ​

typescript
import { defineConfig } from 'vitepress'

export default defineConfig({
  // Site basic configuration
  title: "Site Title",
  description: "Site Description",
  
  // Theme configuration
  themeConfig: {
    // Navigation bar configuration
    nav: [],
    
    // Sidebar configuration
    sidebar: [],
    
    // Social links
    socialLinks: [],
    
    // Footer configuration
    footer: {}
  }
})

Site Basic Configuration ​

title ​

Defines the site title, displayed in browser tab and page header.

typescript
title: "bbd factory"

description ​

Defines the site description for SEO.

typescript
description: "bbd factory studio"

base ​

If the site is deployed in a sub-path:

typescript
base: '/sub-path/'

appearance ​

Controls dark mode toggle:

typescript
appearance: true  // Default, enable dark mode
appearance: false // Disable dark mode

Theme Configuration ​

Navigation (nav) ​

Navigation bar at the top of the page, supports single and multi-level menus.

typescript
nav: [
  { text: 'Home', link: '/' },
  { text: 'Guide', link: '/guide/' }
]

Sidebar ​

Sidebar provides page navigation, can be grouped by directory.

typescript
sidebar: [
  {
    text: 'Guide',
    items: [
      { text: 'Introduction', link: '/guide/introduction' },
      { text: 'Installation', link: '/guide/install' }
    ]
  }
]

Social Links ​

Show social icon links at the bottom of sidebar:

typescript
socialLinks: [
  { icon: 'github', link: 'https://github.com/username/repo' }
]

Footer ​

typescript
footer: {
  message: 'Released under the MIT License.',
  copyright: 'Copyright © 2023-present bbd factory'
}

Notes ​

  1. Configuration changes require restarting the development server
  2. Ensure all link paths are correct to avoid 404 errors
  3. In multi-language sites, you may need to configure different navigation structures for each language
  4. Using TypeScript provides type checking and auto-completion in IDE
  5. Environment variables can be used to distinguish between development and production configurations
